newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Petrofields A up on business conversion.
newsitem.headline: Petrofields A up on business conversion.

text.p: Oil exploration firm Petrofields Exploration and Development Co Inc climbed 0.10 centavos, or 8.33 percent, to 1.30 centavos on Tuesday on news of its transformation into an investment company, brokers said. "That news triggered the buying, boosting sentiment for the stock," said Henry Ong, a Sapphire Securities Inc dealer.
"The conversion is good news for the company especially since there's not much activity in the oil exploration front," said Elline Salvatierra, Dharmala Securities Phils analyst.
Aside from its A shares, B shares of Petrofields also posted gains, rising 0.10 centavos, or 7.69 percent, to 1.40 centavos.
Value turnover of A shares amounted to 278,600 pesos and 486,700 pesos for the B shares.
On Monday, Petrofields said its board had approved the change in the principal purpose of the company to a development and investment management concern.
It said its oil assets would be transferred to a wholly-owned unit, PetroTech Consultants Inc. Stockholder approval for the change would be sought on April 23, the company said.
